name: Crumley, Roger L.
title: Professor & Chief of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery (emeritus)
ngos: American Academy of Facial Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery (President 1995); Triological Society (President 2003); American Laryngological Association (President 2008); American Board of Otolaryngology (12-year elected term)
notes: MD from University of Iowa; joined UCSF faculty 1975 then UC Irvine 1987; Chairman of UCI Dept. of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery 1987-2007; co-founder of the Neurolaryngology Study Group; holds both MD and MBA

name: Delagnes, R. Michael
title: Founding Partner
ngos: San Francisco Child Abuse Prevention Society (co-founder); American Bar Association; California Society of Certified Public Accountants
notes: BS Finance from USF (1969), MBA from Santa Clara (1970), JD from USF (1973); California CPA (1978); former tax manager at KPMG Peat Marwick; former adjunct professor at Golden Gate University in tax programs; co-founded firm in 1981 specializing in estate planning, tax, and real estate law

name: Duckhorn, Daniel James
title: Co-Founder
ngos: Wine Institute (board); American Vintners Association (board); Family Winemakers of California (board); Napa Valley Vintners Association (President); Wine Service Co-op (President); Napa Valley Wine Auction (past chair)
notes: MBA from UC Berkeley (1962); dubbed 'Mr. Merlot' by the New York Times; founded Duckhorn Vineyards in 1976 with wife Margaret; pioneered premium stand-alone Napa Valley Merlot; received honorary Doctor of Oenology from Johnson & Wales University (2005); remained active in management until 2016

name: Eberhard, Andrew J.
title: Senior Advisor
notes: Real estate professional specializing in retail and multifamily properties in Northern California; information from 2010 Bohemian Grove attendee list

name: Higgins, Cory
employer: Legacy Risk & Insurance Services, LLC (Alera Group)
title: Managing Principal / Co-Founder
notes: Third generation insurance broker; joined California Insurance Center (CIC, founded 1929) in 1991; grew CIC into one of California's largest independent brokers; CEO during 2008 merger with Arthur J. Gallagher where he served as Area Chairman; co-founded Legacy Risk & Insurance Services in 2012; Legacy acquired by Alera Group in 2020; based in Walnut Creek, CA

name: Holland, Hank J.
title: Founder and Managing Partner
notes: BS Civil Engineering from Southern Methodist University; MS Agriculture from Colorado State University; over 33 years of investment, finance and risk management experience; formerly Managing Director at Merrill Lynch's Private Bank and Investment Group in San Francisco; previously a principal at AllianceBernstein (Sanford C. Bernstein) for 11 years; joined First Republic Investment Management in 2017; also board member and investor at Amaero International Ltd

name: Machette, Michael H.
title: Owner / Founder
ngos: Jefferson Land Trust (board member); Quimper Geological Society (founder)
notes: BSc Geology from San Jose State University (1972); MSc Quaternary Geology from University of Colorado (1975); Senior Research Geologist at U.S. Geological Survey 1972-2008 in Denver; former chief of USGS Quaternary fault and fold database for USA; Chairman of World Map of Active Faults for the Western Hemisphere; authored approximately 150 scientific papers and maps; retired to Port Townsend, WA in 2008; founded geologic-hazards consulting firm Paleo Seis Surveys LLC

name: Miller, Stephen Roy Jr.
title: Partner
notes: MBA Finance from University of Chicago (1995); began career at Merrill Lynch in 1995; one of the first bankers in Merrill Lynch's technology practice; formerly Executive Vice Chairman of BofA Merrill Lynch; joined Centerview Partners as Partner in Palo Alto office in 2021; has advised on Salesforce.com's $28B acquisition of Slack, Western Digital's $18B acquisition of Sandisk, and Sybase's $7B sale to SAP; registered with FINRA in Menlo Park, CA

name: Nelson, Kipp MacQueen
title: Partner and President
ngos: U.S. Ski & Snowboard (Chairman of the Board of Directors since 2019; 9-year board member); U.S. Ski & Snowboard Foundation (trustee since 2005); Robertson Stephens (board member); CircleBlack (board member); Concertiv (board member); Skaleet (board member); Kipp Nelson Foundation (founder, Ketchum ID)
notes: BA Economics from University of Colorado; former Partner at Goldman Sachs London (Co-Head European Derivatives Business); formerly Co-Head Fixed Income Division Asia and Co-Manager Goldman Asia Distressed Debt Fund; former VP at First National Bank of Chicago; former Director at Credit Suisse First Boston; founding partner of Flashlight Films (produced 'Sully' and 'Trial by Fire'); currently based in Ketchum, ID

name: Osborne, David M.
title: Managing Director (retired)
ngos: Bohemian Club (member); San Francisco Golf Club (member); Menlo Country Club (member); U.S. Olympic Committee (Northern California fundraising Chairman prior to 1984 LA Olympics)
notes: Born December 23, 1936 in San Francisco; joined Salomon Brothers 1966, became General Partner 1972; ran LA office 1967, returned to San Francisco 1974; served as Managing Director with Bechtel Investments (later Fremont Group) until retirement; family home in Woodside, CA; died July 7, 2022 at age 85

name: Read, Morgan James
title: Managing Partner
ngos: International Council of Shopping Centers (former State Director); Young Presidents Organization (member); The Nature Conservancy Leadership Council; California Waterfowl Association (Board of Directors); Fisher Center Policy Advisory Board
notes: MBA and BA Economics from University of Virginia; formerly at Goldman Sachs & Co.; joined family business in 2005 (founded by grandfather Jim Read in 1946 via Grocery Outlet); co-founded R&S Investments and Aquatic Living (multifamily development in SF Bay Area) in 2014; California licensed Real Estate Broker; Read Investments operates across California, Oregon, Idaho and Washington

name: Ricksen, Michael A.
title: Executive Vice President
notes: 24 years of experience in the insurance industry; deep expertise in risk strategy for technology sector clients ranging from startups to public companies; previously at Aon; joined Newfront (San Francisco-based tech-driven specialty insurance brokerage) as EVP in March 2025

name: Rowe, Peter Hamlin
notes: Public records indicate residence in Walnut Creek/Lafayette/Concord area of California

name: Schulte, Bernard H. Jr.
notes: Public records list residence in Carmel By The Sea, CA

name: Sears, John H.
title: Attorney (of counsel / retired)
notes: BS from UC Berkeley (1959); JD from UC Berkeley (1965); practiced corporate and real estate law in San Francisco; previously at Bronson, Bronson & McKinnon; practice areas included real estate acquisitions and dispositions, office and retail leasing, bank formation and sale, corporate finance, partnerships and LLCs; California Bar license listed as inactive as of November 30, 2022; offices in San Francisco and Lafayette

name: Shields, Robert M. Jr.
title: Chairman, President and CEO
ngos: New York Academy of Sciences; Society of Economic Geologists; Society of Mining Engineers; Geological Society of Nevada; American Geophysical Union; MIT Enterprise Forum of NYC
notes: BA from Dartmouth College (1960); doctorate from MIT (1965); MBA from Stanford University Graduate School of Business (1971); founded Piedmont Mining Co. Inc. in 1983; formerly Associate at Morgan Stanley & Co. in corporate finance; age 87; based in New York

name: Singleton, Dennis E.
title: Investor
political_donations: Donated $5,400 to Marco Rubio for President (2015); additional $2,700 donations recorded; Republican-leaning
ngos: Glaucoma Research Foundation (board member since 1998; Chairman July 2003-June 2006); Lehigh University Board of Trustees (emeritus member); Digital Realty Trust (Board of Directors since 2004; Chairman 2012-2017)
notes: BS from Lehigh University; MBA from Harvard Business School; began career at Trammell Crow Company; co-founded Spieker Partners (predecessor to Spieker Properties, one of largest West Coast commercial property owners); CFO & Director of Spieker Properties 1993-1995; CIO & Director 1995-1997; Vice Chairman & Director 1998-2001 until $7.2B acquisition by Equity Office Properties Trust; retired 2001; based in Atherton, CA

name: Wattis, Paul L. Jr
title: President
ngos: Paul L Wattis Foundation (President of the Board; founded 2003, supports Bay Area fine arts and performing arts in SF, Berkeley, Oakland and Marin County)
notes: Investment management professional based in San Francisco Financial District (220 Bush St); grandson or son of Paul L. Wattis (1899-1971), construction and mining magnate whose Utah Construction and Mining company was the primary builder of Hoover Dam; angel investor; board member at Katai; family also established the Phyllis C. Wattis Foundation
